abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives of the Bahia
            Health System Reform Project are to implement the national
            policy of health care decentralization seeking to improve
            access of the poor to Basic Health Care, with improved
            coverage and quality of those health interventions with
            greatest influence over child mortality, maternal mortality,
            and the incidence of diseases prevalent among the poor,
            reduce inequities in the allocation of publicly funded
            health care services, and, improve efficiency andquality in
            the use of public resources, Project components will : 1)
            strengthen the management, and governance of micro-regions,
            by enhancing the role of the micro-region as a purchaser of
            health care services. Technical assistance (TA) will be
            supported, for the deployment of performance based contracts
            between the micro-regions and their local providers,
            including TA, works, and equipment for the implementation of
            Regulation Centers. Furthermore, training, and TA will be
            provided for the adaptation of a unified health system card
            technology. The capacity of micro-regions will be
            strengthened in the conduct of clinical, environmental and
            financial audits, and to initiate as well, a process of
            accreditation, and, TA would support the preparation of
            Medical Waste Plans in health care facilities; 2) conduct
            and analyze health, demographic and social household surveys
            to provide a baseline for the project, and, support
            monitoring and evaluation requirements Likewise, policy
            studies will support implementation of payment systems
            reforms, and improvements in environmental management of
            medical waste. This component will finance technical
            assistance, and training for the introduction of performance
            contracting, the deployment of a Regulation Center for High
            Complexity Care at the state level, the strengthening of
            audit functions, and, accreditation of health care
            providers; and, 3) expand basic care, by strengthening the
            Pacto de Atencao Basica, i.e., Understanding on Basic Health
            Care provision. This sub-component will strengthen the
            state's role in planning, negotiating, monitoring and
            evaluating the "Pacto" through technical
            assistance, training, and equipment supply for the
            implementation of a state-level system of planning municipal
            targets, and, development of a system of consistency checks
            between the various databases pertaining to basic care.
